segments.en: Hello everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Catherine, and we've got another lesson in our series about small talk today.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们将继续我们的闲聊系列课程。

segments.en: That's right, today we are at the office again, and we're going to be talking very briefly about a business meeting that we're going to have soon.
segments.cn: 没错，今天我们又在办公室，我们将简要讨论即将举行的商务会议。

segments.en: That's right, so let's check out our dialogue.
segments.cn: 没错，让我们来看看我们的对话。

segments.en: We'll be back in a moment.
I'm Michelle.
Hi, I was hoping to see you.
How have you been?
How's the family?
Oh, hello Mr. Campbell.
I'm fine and Jack's doing well.
How are you?
I'm fine, thanks.
I got your report this morning.
segments.cn: 我今天早上收到了你的报告。

segments.en: Thanks for that.
Are you joining the conference today?
Yes, I'm leaving at 4pm.
Good, well we can discuss this more then.
segments.cn: 好的，那我们可以再讨论一下。

segments.en: But I think the figures are looking very good for this quarter.
segments.cn: 但我认为这个季度的数字看起来很好。

segments.en: Yes, me too.
I'm planning to discuss the advertising budget at the conference.
segments.cn: 我计划在会议上讨论广告预算。

segments.en: I don't think we should continue with the TV advertising.
segments.cn: 我认为我们不应该继续电视广告。

segments.en: No, me neither.
It's far too expensive.
Well, let's discuss this more at the conference.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们在会议上进一步讨论。

segments.en: Maybe we can share a taxi there?
segments.cn: 也许我们可以一起打车去？

segments.en: Yes, sure.
Alright, we're back, so now let's take a look at some vocab on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了，现在让我们看看一些关于语言的收获。

segments.en: Language Takeaway Today in Language Takeaway we have a number of phrases and words about business.
segments.cn: 语言收获 今天的语言收获中，我们有一些关于商务的短语和单词。

segments.en: The first one we have is, are you joining the conference today?
segments.cn: 第一个是，你今天参加会议吗？

segments.en: That's right, so we're going to go to a conference actually, which is a little bit different than a meeting.
segments.cn: 没错，我们实际上要去一个会议，这与会议有点不同。

segments.en: That's right, a meeting is something you normally do with people at your own company.
segments.cn: 没错，会议通常是你和自己公司的人一起进行的。

segments.en: But a conference is when people from many different companies meet.
segments.cn: 但会议是来自许多不同公司的人员聚集在一起。

segments.en: That's right.
And also I think you don't really have too much input at a conference.
segments.cn: 我认为在会议上你并没有太多发言权。

segments.en: You mostly listen to other people speak about a topic or a subject.
segments.cn: 你主要是听其他人谈论某个主题或话题。

segments.en: That's right, and I think these are normally held in conference centers or hotels.
segments.cn: 没错，我认为这些通常在会议中心或酒店举行。

segments.en: You have a nice lunch, so they're pretty big deals.
segments.cn: 你会享用美味的午餐，所以这些会议相当重要。

segments.en: That's right.
Alright, so it's more of a formal business conference that we're going to.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们要去的是一个更正式的商务会议。

segments.en: And they're actually going to discuss different aspects of the company as well, especially the figures.
segments.cn: 他们实际上也会讨论公司的不同方面，特别是数字。

segments.en: Alright, so in the context of business, the word figure actually means number.
segments.cn: 好吧，在商务的语境中，数字实际上是指数字。

segments.en: So we can say, the sales numbers for this year are a kind of figure.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说，今年的销售数字是一种数字。

segments.en: That's right, so we're talking about money basically when we're talking about numbers.
segments.cn: 没错，所以当我们谈论数字时，基本上是在谈论钱。

segments.en: That's right, so when the figures look good, it means that our income, our revenue, this looks good.
segments.cn: 没错，所以当数字看起来好时，意味着我们的收入、我们的收益看起来不错。

segments.en: That's right.
And when we usually talk about income or revenue, we usually have to separate it into time.
segments.cn: 通常当我们谈论收入或收益时，我们通常需要将其分为时间。

segments.en: And here in the dialogue, we're talking about a quarter.
segments.cn: 在对话中，我们谈论的是一个季度。

segments.en: Alright, so quarter, Q-U, quarter, is a period of time, very common in business, that is a quarter of the year.
segments.cn: 好吧，季度，Q-U，季度，是一个时间段，在商务中非常常见，指的是一年中的一个季度。

segments.en: So three months.
Three months, that's right.
January, February, March, April, May, June, and so on.
segments.cn: 一月、二月、三月、四月、五月、六月，等等。

segments.en: That's right, so you have four quarters, and that's actually why you call it a quarter, because it's one fourth.
segments.cn: 没错，所以你有四个季度，这实际上就是为什么叫它季度，因为它是四分之一。

segments.en: So we can say the figures for the first quarter were very good, but unfortunately the figures for the second quarter were very bad.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说第一季度的数字很好，但不幸的是第二季度的数字很差。

segments.en: That's right, and actually another similar way that you use quarter is the 25 cent coin.
segments.cn: 没错，实际上你使用季度的另一个类似方式是25美分的硬币。

segments.en: It's called a quarter because it's a quarter of a dollar.
segments.cn: 它被称为季度，因为它是美元的四分之一。

segments.en: That's right, and if you're in America, you know that it has an eagle, a bird, on one side of it.
segments.cn: 没错，如果你在美国，你会知道它的一面有一只鹰。

segments.en: That's right.
Alright, so we are taking a look at the figures for the quarter.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们正在查看季度的数字。

segments.en: And they're saying, well, it's not looking too good because we need to talk about the advertising budget.
segments.cn: 他们说，嗯，情况看起来不太好，因为我们需要讨论广告预算。

segments.en: Alright, so this is something that you think is very important.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一件你认为非常重要的事情。

segments.en: It's budget, it's how much money you have to spend on something.
segments.cn: 预算，就是你在某件事情上可以花费的金额。

segments.en: And in this case, you're spending it on advertising, so this is ads that you make.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，你是在广告上花费，所以这是你制作的广告。

segments.en: That's right.
So as you said, a budget is the amount of money that you have available to spend on something.
segments.cn: 正如你所说，预算是你可以花费在某件事情上的金额。

segments.en: And on this occasion, we're talking about advertising.
segments.cn: 在这个场合，我们谈论的是广告。

segments.en: Now, you can have a budget for different things, right?
segments.cn: 现在，你可以为不同的事情设定预算，对吧？

segments.en: You could have a marketing budget.
segments.cn: 你可以有一个市场预算。

segments.en: So the money you have for marketing.
segments.cn: 所以你用于市场营销的资金。

segments.en: You could have a personnel budget, which is the money you would set aside for people.
segments.cn: 你可以有一个人事预算，即你为员工预留的资金。

segments.en: So how much you pay your employees.
segments.cn: 所以你支付给员工的金额。

segments.en: Right, so you can pretty much mix up many different nouns with budget.
segments.cn: 对，所以你可以将许多不同的名词与预算混合使用。

segments.en: Even you can have a budget for your home.
segments.cn: 甚至你可以为你的家庭设定预算。

segments.en: How much you spend at home.
That's right, so many people have this for their families.
segments.cn: 没错，所以许多人为他们的家庭设定预算。

segments.en: They say, this month I will spend $100 on shopping and $200 on shoes.
segments.cn: 他们说，这个月我将在购物上花100美元，在鞋子上花200美元。

segments.en: So it's like a family budget, you would call it.
segments.cn: 所以这就像是家庭预算，你可以这么称呼。

segments.en: That's right.
Okay, so that's all the words we have for you on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们在语言收获中为你准备的所有单词。

segments.en: Let's review everything quickly, and we'll be back in a bit with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 让我们快速回顾一下所有内容，我们稍后会回来进行流利度提升。

segments.en: Ah, Michelle, hi!
I was hoping to see you.
How have you been?
How's the family?
Oh, hello Mr. Campbell.
I'm fine and Jack's doing well.
How are you?
I'm fine, thanks.
I got your report this morning.
segments.cn: 我今天早上收到了你的报告。

segments.en: Thanks for that.
Are you joining the conference today?
Yes, I'm leaving at 4pm.
Good, well we can discuss this more then.
segments.cn: 好的，那我们可以再讨论一下。

segments.en: But I think the figures are looking very good for this quarter.
segments.cn: 但我认为这个季度的数字看起来很好。

segments.en: Yes, me too.
I'm planning to discuss the advertising budget at the conference.
segments.cn: 我计划在会议上讨论广告预算。

segments.en: I don't think we should continue with the TV advertising.
segments.cn: 我认为我们不应该继续电视广告。

segments.en: No, me neither.
It's far too expensive.
Well, let's discuss this more at the conference.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在会议上再讨论这个。

segments.en: Maybe we can share a taxi there?
segments.cn: 也许我们可以一起打车去？

segments.en: Yes, sure.
Alright, in today's Fluency Builder we have a number of phrases you could use in a small talk situation.
segments.cn: 好的，在今天的流利表达中，我们有一些可以在闲聊中使用的短语。

segments.en: The first one is a question.
How's the family?
How's the family?
Now, it's how apostrophe s the family, right?
segments.cn: 现在是“家里怎么样”，对吗？

segments.en: So how is the family would be the extended way of saying it.
segments.cn: 所以“家里怎么样”是更完整的说法。

segments.en: That's right, but this is a short way to say it.
segments.cn: 没错，但这是简短的说法。

segments.en: It's very common and you normally say this with people who are a little bit older.
segments.cn: 这很常见，通常你会对稍微年长的人这样说。

segments.en: People who have kids.
So I haven't seen you in a long time, Marco.
segments.cn: 所以我很久没见到你了，马尔科。

segments.en: And I know you have some kids and I can say, how's the family?
segments.cn: 我知道你有孩子，我可以问，家里怎么样？

segments.en: How's the family, that's right.
And it's actually, it may seem strange the way that this sentence is made.
segments.cn: 其实，这句话的构造可能看起来奇怪。

segments.en: But it's very, very much similar to how are you.
segments.cn: 但这和“你好吗”非常相似。

segments.en: You have how to be and you in the subject.
segments.cn: 你有“如何”这个动词和“你”这个主语。

segments.en: That's right.
And this is a very polite way to say hi.
segments.cn: 这是一种非常礼貌的问候方式。

segments.en: How are you?
How is your family?
How is the wife?
How's the wife?
How's the wife?
And she said, well, you know what?
Everything is great.
I'm fine.
And Jack's, I guess that's her husband, is doing well.
segments.cn: 杰克，我想那是她的丈夫，过得不错。

segments.en: Jack is doing well.
So doing well, thanks.
This means good.
Okay.
But you know, when we say the answer to this question, how are you?
segments.cn: 但是你知道，当我们回答这个问题“你好吗？”时，

segments.en: I'm well.
That's the correct answer.
I'm good is not correct.
Right.
So if somebody says, how are you?
segments.cn: 所以如果有人问，“你好吗？”

segments.en: You can say, I'm well.
Or you can say, I'm doing well.
segments.cn: 或者你可以说，“我过得不错。”

segments.en: That's a positive answer.
Things are going well.
You could say, not so well.
That's not good things are happening.
Very good.
And it's very important to point out the difference, as Catherine said.
segments.cn: 指出这个区别非常重要，正如凯瑟琳所说。

segments.en: You shouldn't use good.
I'm doing good or I'm good.
Yeah, no, it's incorrect because good is an adjective and we're looking for an adverb here.
segments.cn: 是的，不，这是不正确的，因为“好”是形容词，而我们在这里寻找的是副词。

segments.en: That's right.
Well.
That's right.
Alright, and to finish things off, Mr. Campbell and Michelle were headed the same way.
segments.cn: 好的，最后，坎贝尔先生和米歇尔走的是同一条路。

segments.en: So they decided to share a taxi.
segments.cn: 所以他们决定共享一辆出租车。

segments.en: That's right.
So to share a taxi means two people or three people will pay for one taxi together.
segments.cn: 共享出租车意味着两个人或三个人一起支付一辆出租车的费用。

segments.en: So maybe Marco, I see you on the street and I know that you have to go to a conference.
segments.cn: 所以也许马尔科，我在街上看到你，我知道你要去参加会议。

segments.en: I'm going to the same conference.
Let's share a taxi.
It will cost less.
That's right.
So you will share the cost between all the people in the cab.
segments.cn: 所以你会在出租车里和所有人分摊费用。

segments.en: Now there's another way of saying it as well.
More common, I think, in the United States.
That's right.
We say split a taxi.
Let's split a cab.
Let's split a cab.
Now remember that it's a taxi cab.
So sometimes people just don't say taxi.
segments.cn: 所以有时人们只说出租车。

segments.en: They say a cab.
Let's split a cab.
Let's share a cab.
That's right.
Cab, taxi, both are okay.
segments.cn: 出租车，出租车，两者都可以。

segments.en: Alright.
Very good.
Good stuff.
Let's listen to everything one last time.
Ah, Michelle.
Hi.
I was hoping to see you.
How have you been?
How's the family?
Oh, hello, Mr. Campbell.
I'm fine and Jack's doing well.
How are you?
I'm fine, thanks.
I got your report this morning.
segments.cn: 我今天早上收到了你的报告。

segments.en: Thanks for that.
Are you joining the conference today?
Yes, I'm leaving at 4pm.
Good.
Well, we can discuss this more then.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们可以再讨论一下。

segments.en: But I think the figures are looking very good for this quarter.
segments.cn: 但我认为这个季度的数字看起来很好。

segments.en: Yes, me too.
I'm planning to discuss the advertising budget at the conference.
segments.cn: 我打算在会议上讨论广告预算。

segments.en: I don't think we should continue with the TV advertising.
segments.cn: 我认为我们不应该继续电视广告。

segments.en: No, me neither.
It's far too expensive.
Well, let's discuss this more at the conference.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在会议上再讨论这个。

segments.en: Maybe we can share a taxi there?
segments.cn: 也许我们可以一起打车去？

segments.en: Yes, sir.
Alright, so we're getting towards the end of our small talk series.
segments.cn: 好的，我们的小谈话系列快结束了。

segments.en: As you can see, we are taking a look at different, quick, but very useful dialogues that you can have with someone.
segments.cn: 如你所见，我们正在看一些不同的、快速但非常有用的对话。

segments.en: A small conversation, whether about business, family, whatever.
segments.cn: 一段小对话，无论是关于商业、家庭，还是其他。

segments.en: That's right.
And in today's dialogue, we heard two people who probably know each other talking.
segments.cn: 在今天的对话中，我们听到两个人可能相互认识的谈话。

segments.en: So, sometimes you're with people who are strangers, you don't know what to say to them.
segments.cn: 所以，有时你和陌生人在一起，不知道该对他们说什么。

segments.en: You can listen to our other episodes on small talk for things to talk about with those people.
segments.cn: 你可以听我们的其他小谈话集，了解与这些人交谈的话题。

segments.en: That's right.
And of course, if you have any questions or comments, you can visit us at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 当然，如果你有任何问题或评论，可以访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: We hope to see you all there.
segments.cn: 我们希望在那儿见到你们。

segments.en: Until next time.
Bye.
